intro: Mesembryanthemum protractum, commonly known as the protractum iceplant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers, which are often pink or purple, bloom in the morning and close by afternoon. Mesembryanthemum protractum is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in drought conditions.
